string.text: Boar's hoof
Boar's hoof is used by scientists to produce a number of medicines, the most common of which is an anti-radiation serum.
Dog tail

The resistance of mutant dogs' skin to electricity and chemical agents has long been the subject of scientific attention. Since the animal's tail is almost completely free of fat tissue, it is especially suited for lab examination.
Flesh eye

The mutated, swollen eye of the Flesh acquired a number of strange characteristics, the most useful of which is the ability to regenerate the lens. The specifics of the process are hitherto unknown, although such discovery would most certainly revolutionize modern medicine. You can play your part in scientific development by selling Flesh eyes to scientists for their experiments.
Bloodsucker tentacles

Bloodsucker tentacles contain a special gland producing a ferment capable of dissolving the skin and simultaneously preventing blood from clotting. Discovering the ferment's composition could be the cornerstone of a whole series of great medical advances.
Pseudodog tail

The resistance of mutant dogs' skin to electricity and chemical agents has long been the subject of scientific attention. Since the animal's tail is almost completely free of fat tissue, it is especially suited for lab examination.
Snork foot
Snork feet contain a huge number of highly elastic tendons. This explains the beast's ability to make those unbelievably long jumps.
Controller's hand

The controller's psy abilities allow it to create various hallucinations at a distance, as well as inflict damage in close range. Scientists belive that its powers lie in its hand. The controller's hand has yet to be fully investigated.
Pseudogiant's hand
The pseudogiant's hand has properties that scientists have not yet explained, but they will pay good money for it.
Poltergeist's Eye
No one knows why the scientists need a poltergeist's eye, but they pay good money for it.
Tushkano's head

Tushkanos have a highly developed intelligence, and scientists are trying to figure out how their tiny brains hold a lot of information. Scientists make medicine from their brains, but that's as much as stalkers know, as the brains are transported out of the Zone for unknown purposes.
Burer's hand

Burer's hand has acquired a number of properties, the most useful of which is a strong resistance to radiation. The exact reasons for this are not exactly known. You can contribute to science by selling the burer's hand to scientists for research.
Chimera's Claw
The chimera can easily cut through metal with its claws. The molecular structure of the mutant's claw tissues is of great interest to scientists.
